result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shayla I. Arnold

records.addlTxt: Attorney David Field at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 11/18/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

9:59 AM cases 22CM492, 22CM633 called. Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shayla I. Arnold in court without counsel. There is an offer and the Defendant has a meeting the end of September with the DAGP coordinator.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:40am Cases called: 22CM633 & 22CM492. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shayla I. Arnold in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney and Constitutional rights. Defendant is working on obtaining counsel. 

22CM633: waives reading of the complaint. Bond is set. Defendant is ordered to be fingerprinted. 

Both cases: Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/15/22 at 1:45pm
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with victim S.A. or their residence.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
